newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Ireland Funds says over $10 raised in U.S. in 1995.
newsitem.headline: Ireland Funds says over $10 raised in U.S. in 1995.

text.p: Over $10 million was raised by Irish benevolent trust, The Ireland Funds, in the U.S in 1995, and over half of this was paid in grants to over 280 projects in Ireland.
"The 1995 performance brings the total raised for projects in Ireland by the Ireland Funds to date to almost $70 million," the trust said in a statement.
The Ireland Funds have become one of the world's largest private-sector foundations, channelling money to projects throughout the island of Ireland.
Founded in 1976, Ireland Funds is chaired by Irish businessman Tony O'Reilly and it supports projects throughout Ireland that encourage peace, culture and community development.
